trans-unit.source: Defines a design-time object that is used to build strongly-typed runtime grammars that conform to the [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](http://www.w3.org/TR/speech-grammar/).

You can you construct an empty <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> instance and build a grammar by adding instances of classes that represent SRGS elements, such as <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule>, <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf>,<xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem>, <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef>, <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsSemanticInterpretationTag>, and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsToken>.

You can also construct an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> instance from an existing SRGS-compliant XML grammar file, from an instance of <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule>, or from an instance of <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.GrammarBuilder>.

After the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> object is created, it can be loaded into a <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.Grammar> object or compiled by <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsGrammarCompiler>, enabling it to be read by a <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.Grammar> object.

See [Create Grammars Using SrgsGrammar](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e4d9f96e-2241-4c39-b9e0-ac9ef4e9a906) in the [System Speech Programming Guide for .NET Framework 4.0](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/610116c7-3817-40ff-857b-5d41e8511043) for more information and examples.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> instance.

To build a grammar within an empty <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> instance, add instances of classes that represent SRGS elements, such as <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule>, <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef>, <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf>, and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class from a <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.GrammarBuilder"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.GrammarBuilder"></xref> object used to create the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
builder is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class and specifies an <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule"></xref> object to be the root rule of the grammar.

This constructor adds the specified rule to the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRulesCollection> of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> object and sets it as the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Root%2A> rule for the grammar.
The `root rule` in the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> object.
grammarRootRule is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class specifying the location of the XML document that is used to fill in the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
The location of the SRGS XML file.
path is `null`.
path is an empty string.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class from an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> that references an XML-format grammar file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> object that was created with the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> XML instance.
srgsGrammar is `null`.
Gets the assembly reference information for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.AssemblyReferences"></xref> property returns a string collection containing a list of the assembly references.
Gets the code-behind information for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.CodeBehind"></xref> property returns a string collection that contains a list of the code-behind documents.
Gets or sets the culture information for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
Microsoft Windows and the System.Speech API accept all valid language-country codes.

To perform speech recognition using the language specified in the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Culture%2A> property, a speech recognition engine that supports that language-country code must be installed.
The speech recognition engines that shipped with Microsoft Windows 7 work with the following language-country codes.
en-GB.
English (United Kingdom)
en-US.
English (United States)
de-DE.
German (Germany)
es-ES.
Spanish (Spain)
fr-FR.
French (France)
ja-JP.
Japanese (Japan)
zh-CN.
Chinese (China)
zh-TW.
Chinese (Taiwan)
Two-letter language codes such as "en", "fr", or "es" are also permitted.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that contains the current culture information for <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref>.
The value being assigned to <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Culture"></xref> is `null`.
The value being assigned to <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Culture"></xref> is <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture"></xref>.
Gets or sets whether line numbers should be added to inline scripts.

The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Debug"></xref> property returns `true` if line numbers should be added for debugging purposes; otherwise the property returns `false`.
Gets the related namespaces for the current <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.

The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.ImportNamespaces"></xref> property returns a string collection that contains a list of the related namespaces in the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
Gets or sets the programming language used for inline code in the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Language"></xref> property returns the programming language to which <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> is currently set.
Gets or sets the mode for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Mode%2A> property returns a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsGrammarMode> that determines the type of input that the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> expects.
The two possible values are `Voice` for speech input, and `Dtmf` for input of dual-tone multi-frequency (DTMF) tones that are commonly associated with a telephone.
The recognition mode of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref>.
Gets or sets the namespace of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Namespace"></xref> property returns the namespace for the current <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref>.
Gets or sets the phonetic alphabet of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.
Phonetic alphabets are composed of phones, which consist of letters, numbers or characters, sometimes in combination.
Each phone describes a unique sound of speech.
This is in contrast to the Latin alphabet, for which any letter may represent multiple spoken sounds.
Consider the different pronunciations of the letter "c" in the words "candy" and "cease", or the different pronunciations of the letter combination "th" in the words "thing" and "those".
In System.Speech, you can use any of three phonetic alphabets to specify custom pronunciations: International Phone Alphabet (IPA), Universal Phone Set (UPS), or the SAPI phone set.
The specified phonetic alphabet determines which phone set will be used to define inline pronunciations for <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsToken> objects.

The phones specified in <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsToken.Pronunciation%2A> must match the phonetic alphabet specified in <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.PhoneticAlphabet%2A>.
See [Lexicons and Phonetic Alphabets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/435e3c6f-6834-4e5a-b0f6-c17b2275dc51) for more information.
Returns the phonetic alphabet that must be used to specify custom pronunciations in the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsToken"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the root rule of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> object must already be in the document's <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRulesCollection> before it can be set to the **root rule**.

You can also set the root rule for an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> object by using an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> object as the argument to the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> constructor.
Returns the rule that is designated as the root rule of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref>.
Gets the collection of rules that are currently defined for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.

You can add <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> objects to the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRulesCollection> by using the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRulesCollection.Add%2A> method on the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Rules%2A> property.

If you initialize an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> object and specify an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> object as the argument, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> is automatically added to the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRulesCollection> for the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument>.
Returns the rules defined for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the .NET scripting language for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.
This property has been deprecated.
Its use is no longer recommended.
The `Script` property returns the current .NET scripting language for the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.
An attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Script"></xref> property to null.
An attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.Script"></xref> property to an empty string.

Writes the contents of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> object to an XML-format grammar file that conforms to the [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201761).
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to write the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> instance.
srgsGrammar is `null`.
Gets or sets the base URI of the <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.XmlBase%2A> property gets a value that is used to resolve relative URIs in a <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> object.

Suppose the value for <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument.XmlBase%2A> is "http://www.contoso.com/" and the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument> contains a relative rule reference to another document, for example `SrgsRuleRef("ExternalGrammar.grxml")`.
This creates the following absolute path to the external document: `http://www.contoso.com/ExternalGrammar.grxml`.
The current base URI of <xref href="System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsDocument"></xref>.
